intro: Sida dubia, commonly known as the common sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and lobed leaves with a hairy texture. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sida dubia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
